p: Female Antarctic fur seals forage in a complex marine environment, around the Kerguelen Islands (49°00′S, 70°00′E) [ 12– 14, 22– 26], in the vicinity of highly productive frontal systems: the Antarctic Polar Frontal Zone, which is delimited southward by the Polar Front and northward by the Subtropical Front [ 24, 33, 34]. Female fur seals feed almost exclusively at night at depth ranging from 20 to 60 m [ 24], when their prey resource (lantern fishes, Myctophydae) migrates towards the surface [ 23, 28].
